jdd

Class DebugJDD

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdd.DebugJDD

  • public class DebugJDD
extends java.lang.Object
    Framework for debugging JDDNode and CUDD reference counting.
    If DebugJDD is enabled (via calling DebugJDD.enabled()), instead of normal JDDNodes, DebugJDDNodes are used. These track the balance of referencing and dereferencing, etc and throw errors or provide warnings if something problematic occurs.
    In addition, each DebugJDDNode carries a unique ID, which is persistent over multiple invocations of PRISM, in contrast to the DdNode pointers of CUDD, which are raw C/C++ pointers and can differ between multiple PRISM runs, making tracking more difficult.
    You can enable tracing for a particular ID, which will print status messages for each event for this particular JDDNode, e.g., whenever the node is referenced, dereferenced, consumed in a JDD method, copied, etc.
    In the end, if there are reference leaks, a list of potential JDDNode IDs is printed. These can then be used for tracing the referencing and dereferencing of these nodes in a subsequent run of PRISM to debug the reference leak.
    Note: For the JDDNodes that are returned by JDDNode.getThen() and JDDNode.getElse(), a different handling applies. As these are generally only used for traversing an MTBDD and are not referenced (beyond the internal CUDD references that are there due to the fact that they are internal nodes of some MTBDD), they are wrapped in a "light-weight" variant of DebugJDDNode called DebugJDDNodeLight. They are not fully functional and should never be used for JDD.Ref, JDD.Deref or as the argument of a JDD method, except to compare for equality, getting the variable index, getThen() and getElse() and obtaining constant value of a terminal node. You can also call copy() on them to obtain a "proper" node.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  DebugJDD.DebugJDDNode
      A DebugJDDNode extends a JDDNode with additional information useful for tracking refs/derefs and tracing.
      protected static class  DebugJDD.DebugJDDNodeLight
      A "light-weight" DebugJDDNode, for marking JDDNodes that have been obtained by a call from getThen()/getElse() and thus don't take part in the usual reference counting scheme.

    • Field Detail

      • debugEnabled

        public static boolean debugEnabled
        Flag, determines if the debugging of JDD nodes is enabled. Default off.

      • traceAll

        public static boolean traceAll
        Flag, determines if all nodes should be traced (in contrast to only those specified using enableTracingForID(). Default off.

      • traceFollowCopies

        public static boolean traceFollowCopies
        Flag, determines if copies of traced nodes should be traced as well. Default off.

      • warningsAreFatal

        public static boolean warningsAreFatal
        Flag, determines if warnings should be promoted to errors, i.e., throwing an exception. Default off.

      • warningsOff

        public static boolean warningsOff
        Flag, determines if warnings should be suppressed. Default off.

      • nodes

        protected static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Long,DebugJDD.DebugJDDNode> nodes
        Map from DebugJDDNode IDs to DebugJDDNode. LinkedHashMap to ensure that iterating over the map returns the DebugJDDNodes in a consistent order, sorted by ID.

      • javaRefs

        protected static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer> javaRefs
        A map from DdNode pointers to the current sum of the nodeRefs of all JDDNodes for that pointer

        protected static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Long> traceIDs
        An optional set of DebugJDDNode IDs that will be traced

        protected static boolean raisedError
        Did we raise an error?

      • Ref

        protected static void Ref(JDDNode node)
        DebugJDD implementation of JDD.Ref.
        Increments both the CUDD reference counter and the reference counter for the JDDNode.

      • Deref

        protected static void Deref(JDDNode node)
        DebugJDD implementation of JDD.Deref.
        Decrements both the CUDD reference counter and the reference counter for the JDDNode, performing a variety of sanity checks.

      • Copy

        protected static JDDNode Copy(JDDNode node)
        DebugJDD implementation of JDDNode.copy().
        Increments the reference count for the copy and handles tracing.

      • ptrToNode

        protected static JDDNode ptrToNode(long ptr)
        DebugJDD implementation of JDD.ptrToNode, i.e., converting a (referenced) DdNode ptr returned by the DD_* CUDD abstraction layer into a proper JDDNode.

      • useNode

        private static void useNode(DebugJDD.DebugJDDNode node)
        Common checks for the case where a DebugJDDNode is used (passed as a method argument or with getThen(), getElse() or getValue()).
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - in case of a problem

      • DD_Method_Argument

        protected static void DD_Method_Argument(JDDNode node)
        DebugJDD handling of passing JDDNodes as arguments to the DD_* layer, where they will be ultimately dereferenced.
        As the actual dereferencing in CUDD will only happen after the given MTBDD method is finished, we only decrement the reference counter on the DebugJDD side.

      • nodeGetThen

        protected static JDDNode nodeGetThen(JDDNode node)
        DebugJDD handling of JDDNode.getThen(). Returns a DebugJDDNodeLight wrapper around the result.

      • nodeGetElse

        protected static JDDNode nodeGetElse(JDDNode node)
        DebugJDD handling of JDDNode.getElse(). Returns a DebugJDDNodeLight wrapper around the result.

      • nodeGetValue

        protected static double nodeGetValue(JDDNode node)
        DebugJDD handling of JDDNode.getValue(). Performs check to ensure that the reference counting is fine and that the node is actually a constant node.
